page.title: 15A Tale of Two Pubs
page.content: {(1)}An{Ordnance Survey map}dated{1886 shows a public house called{The Royal {Oak.}The building stands beside the main road close by the school.It was owned by{Hampton Court Estate.}Local residents,travellers,farm & estate workers used it.In the{1920's}the pub was{shut}by its owners because estate {workers}from their saw mill went there at lunchtime and got{too drunk to}do any more{work.}It's now a house called Oakdene and bears the date 1891. {(2)}By{Winsley hill}is{Cold Ash.}It was a farm with several cottages close by.One of these{cottages,}which no longer exist,was known as{The Donkey's {Arms.}Probably it wasn't a pub at all, but a place where{Scrumpy}(home made rough cider) was sold to any farm labourer who wanted it. NOTE: There is{no public house in Hope The nearest is The Railway at Dinmore.
